A lot of people think that getting a massage is a luxury. There are those who assume that it is merely a way to flirt with someone else. Even though it is true that there are some who say that getting massaged regularly is important but the truth is that the major benefits of massage are still being found out. Have you been trying to find out if you should fork out the bucks for a massage on a regular basis? Below are some not yet widely known benefits of massages!

Massage makes your brain's chemical makeup change. These changes help to bring down both pain and stress levels in your entire body. This is important because it means that you do not have to physically massage the exact spot that is hurting. For example, if you aren't thrilled with the idea of letting someone touch your lower back, ask them to concentrate on your arms and shoulders instead. The pressure there transmits a signal to your brain so that the chemical responses can change. Give it a little bit of time and your other muscles will relax too.

It's possible, according to a number of experts, that regular massage helps you to stay healthy. There have been studies that show massage improves your immune system which makes it easier for you to fight off illness and disease. This occurs because massage promotes the increase of your body's de-stressors. To use one example, science has discovered that the cortisol levels in your body are decreased when you get a massage regularly. Cortisol is induced by stress and it attacks your body's immune system so lowering your stress levels can only help you continue to be healthy.

Are you aware that massage can help bring down your blood pressure? Hypertension is lowered too. This happens because massage sets off the nervus vagus which is responsible for helping the brain regulate the levels of your blood pressure and other vital bodily functions. A 2005 study discovered that those who have hypertension showed a noticeable improvement in their levels after getting just ten ten-minute massages over the course of a few weeks.

You can certainly massage yourself too. There are quite a few individuals who assume that massage should be performed by another person but that isn't really true. You don't have to massage the precise spot that is in pain so long as you get close to the area. One example of this is an individual who has carpal tunnel syndrome can help himself by massaging his own arms a few times a week.
